seniority_level.evidence: No explicit years mentioned, but responsibilities include end-to-end development, data modeling, and governance - typical mid-level expectations. Title is 'Data Engineer' without senior/staff prefix.

job_family.evidence: Job title is explicitly 'Data Engineer' and responsibilities focus on ELT pipelines, data warehousing, and platform maintenance.

sub_specialty.evidence: Emphasis on ELT pipelines, data warehousing, Kimball methodology, and tools like DBT and Fivetran - all aligned with batch ETL workflows.

leadership_expectation.evidence: No mention of managing people, mentoring, or technical leadership responsibilities. Focus is on individual contribution and collaboration with stakeholders.

primary_cloud.evidence: AWS explicitly mentioned in must-have skills, including AWS CDK. Snowflake, BigQuery, and Redshift are listed but AWS is the only cloud infrastructure specified.

secondary_clouds.evidence: BigQuery (GCP) and Redshift (AWS) are listed, but BigQuery implies GCP as a secondary platform. Azure is not mentioned, but included as a possible secondary due to multi-cloud data platform context.

processing_paradigm.evidence: Focus on ELT pipelines, data warehousing, and CI/CD practices suggests batch processing. No streaming tools like Kafka or Flink mentioned.

orchestrator_category.evidence: DBT is explicitly listed as a must-have skill and is central to modern data transformation orchestration.

storage_layer.evidence: Snowflake, BigQuery, and Redshift are all cloud data warehouses. Kimball methodology is also mentioned, which is warehouse-centric.

remote_restriction.evidence: Location restricted to Manchester, UK. Pass 1 extraction confirms 'uk_only' geo restriction.

timezone_focus.evidence: Explicitly UK-based role with Manchester location. No mention of global or multi-timezone teams.

relocation_required.evidence: Hybrid model requires 50% in-office time in Manchester. New hires must be able to work from office initially, implying relocation may be required for non-local candidates.

h1b_friendly.evidence: No mention of visa sponsorship. UK-based role with no indication of international hiring support.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No mention of student visas or OPT/CPT. UK-based role implies local work authorization required.

citizenship_required.evidence: No explicit citizenship requirement, but location restriction to UK implies must be authorized to work in the UK.

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Full-time permanent position with comprehensive benefits (pension, healthcare, etc.) suggests W2 employment.

benefits_level.evidence: Extensive benefits list including equity (share awards), pension matching, private healthcare, learning support, and social events.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: Mentions 'talent development programmes' and 'ongoing technical training' but no explicit career tracks or promotion ladder.

mentorship_signals.evidence: Mentions joining an 'experienced Data Engineering team' and collaborating with stakeholders, suggesting learning from senior colleagues.

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No explicit mention of promotions, advancement, or career progression paths.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No mention of internal transfers, lateral moves, or exploring other roles within the company.

career_tracks_available.evidence: No explicit mention of IC, management, or specialist tracks. Only general development programs referenced.

requirement_strictness.evidence: Clear must-have skills listed (20+ items) with no nice-to-haves, suggesting moderate strictness. Soft skills are general and flexible.

scope_definition.evidence: Focused on data engineering responsibilities: ELT pipelines, data warehousing, modeling, and governance. No hybrid or multi-role indications.

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Skill set is broad but reasonable for a mid-level data engineer in a financial services context. No unrealistic combinations or senior-level requirements for junior role.
